thread.title: Local pupils do their bit for high-flying Saddlers
thread.title_full: Local pupils do their bit for high-flying Saddlers

title: Local pupils do their bit for high-flying Saddlers
text:
Tweet 
Youngsters from the two schools acted as ballboys for the match which saw Saddlers run out 2-0 winners in front of nearly 7,000 spectators. 
Most of the Chase View boys had been to the Banks’s Stadium as ballboys before but for the Landywood contingent this was a new exciting experience. 
Before the game the boys enjoyed 90 minutes football on the academy pitch before the main part of the afternoon began. About 20 minutes before kick-off they went out on to the pitch and lined up to meet and welcome the teams. They then took their pitch-side seats, which were undoubtably the best in the ground, to help the game run smoothly and hopefully do their bit to help the Saddlers top the league. 
The atmosphere around all four sides of the ground was fantastic from the beginning. 
This was a real afternoon to remember with all of the 54 boys having a story to tell about something they heard or saw from their pitch-side seats. They were all buzzing at the end and are thrilled to have done their bit to help Dean Smith’s men reach the summint of League One. What do you think? Be the first to comment 
A signed Walsall ball and complimentary tickets were awarded to Reis Ballantyne-Bailey from Landywood School for showing a stand-out effort in training and marking his first time as a Walsall ballboy. 
Many of the children will return to Walsall in December to do the same job again when Walsall play Port Vale. Receive daily email updates from the Express & Star
